reasoning: Alpha-1-antitrypsin (AAT) deficiency is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder affecting protease inhibitor production, causing progressive lung disease and liver cirrhosis. Incidence approximately 1-2 per 100k globally; prevalence around 25 per 100k in at-risk populations. Autosomal recessive inheritance pattern more common in Europeans.
source: NHLBI COPD Facts: Alpha-1-Antitrypsin Deficiency (NIH); Stoller & Aboussouan (2005). Alpha1-antitrypsin deficiency. Lancet. 365:2225-36
